description: Conversion of garage into home gym/playroom /study and associated external alterations involving the replacement of garage doors and insertion of windows into the front elevation
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Application form, P3701, 01 (Site Plan and Block Plan), 02 (Existing and Proposed Elevations and Sections), 03 (Existing and Proposed floor Plans), 04 (Existing and Proposed Lower Ground Floor Plan).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | The home gym/playroom/study hereby permitted shall be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the main dwellinghouse at 37 Allingham Close, Hanwell, London, W7 1NB Hanwell, W7 1JN only and not for any other separate commercial, residential or industrial use.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation or any other use seperate in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the conversion of the garage into a habitable room does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), SPG 4, and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | No kitchen shall be installed into the development hereby permitted at any time.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), SPG 4, and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), SPG 4, policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The windows of the proposed development will be inserted within the replacement garage doors. The frame of the window will be flush with garage door and will match the door in appearance. The appearance of the garage doors will remain in perpetuity.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and result in good quality architecture, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
